show the process file in explorer whose window under mouse cursor.

import ctypes

pos=ctypes.c_uint64()
ctypes.windll.user32.GetCursorPos(ctypes.byref(pos))
hwnd=ctypes.windll.user32.WindowFromPoint(pos)
pid=ctypes.c_uint32()
ctypes.windll.user32.GetWindowThreadProcessId(hwnd,ctypes.byref(pid))
handle=ctypes.windll.kernel32.OpenProcess(0x1F0FFF,0,pid)
buf=ctypes.create_unicode_buffer(256)
ctypes.windll.psapi.GetModuleFileNameExW(handle,0,buf,256)
path=buf.value
shell_execute(path,1)
kill the process whose window under mouse cursor.

import ctypes

pos=ctypes.c_uint64()
ctypes.windll.user32.GetCursorPos(ctypes.byref(pos))
hwnd=ctypes.windll.user32.WindowFromPoint(pos)
pid=ctypes.c_uint32()
ctypes.windll.user32.GetWindowThreadProcessId(hwnd,ctypes.byref(pid))
pid=pid.value
myid=ctypes.windll.kernel32.GetCurrentProcessId()

if not myid==pid:
 handle=ctypes.windll.kernel32.OpenProcess(0x1F0FFF,0,pid)
 ctypes.windll.kernel32.TerminateProcess(handle,0)

from clipboard import cb2fn
from jpg2pdf import AddFile,ClrFile,GenPdf

ClrFile()
li=list(cb2fn())
for fn in li:
 if fn.lower().endswith('.jpg'):
  AddFile(fn)
GenPdf(li[0][:li[0].rfind('\\')+1]+'12345.pdf')
